intro: Mendoncia aspera var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and alternate leaves that are typically rounded or oval in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish flowers, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
